Title: 3rd Sector provision of NHS funded Health Services in North West London
Description:
Central London, Hammersmith & Fulham and West London CCGs recognise the value and benefit to be offered by 3rd sector organisations in the design and delivery of health care services to local patients.
Perceptions and experiences of NHS procurement processes can be off putting to many 3rd sector organisations when NHS commissioners are offering contracts to deliver health related services.  Whilst NHS commissioners often receive high quality tenders from the 3rd sector, they have also received tenders much less likely to succeed in winning a contract following a competitive tendering process.
3rd sector organisations having a potential interest in the provision of health care related services in the localities of the above CCGs (within North West London) are invited to attend an engagement event in the Westminster area of London at 12noon till 3pm on Friday 12th June 2015.
The event will include key input from NHS Shared Business Services, who are now supporting the NW London CCGs in the field of procurement process and the event will include:
**When do NHS Commissioners need to use competitive tendering? **Understanding what NHS Commissioners are looking for when inviting bids.  **What makes a good tender submission?  What does a bad tender look like?  **What should 3rd sector organisations be considering together?  **Myth busting and a question & answer session.
If the above is beneficial to better understand as a 3rd sector organisation, express your interest to attend by getting in touch ASAP, as places will need to be limited.
Contact Address 1: NW West London Clinical Commissioning Group
Additional Text: ***TO REGISTER YOUR INTEREST TO ATTEND this engagement event, PLEASE RESPOND BY EMAIL with the subject heading “Interest to attend 3rd Sector Procurement Event” to Kalwant.Sahota@inwl.nhs.uk, confirming your contact details and 3rd sector organisation being represented . Details of the venue will be confirmed in response if your request to attend is accepted.

Organisation Name: NHS South East Commissioning Support Unit
Title: Any Qualified Provider (AQP) Independent Sector Elective Care Services  - NHS West Kent CCG
Description:
NHS West Kent Clinical Commissioning Group are seeking to  procure the provision of Independent Sector Elective Care Services through AQP.
All existing providers MUST reapply to continue providing this service from 01 July 2015.  All providers that wish to submit an application form, whether existing or new providers, must read the attached documents (available on the Bravo website).  
Please note that under ‘Any Qualified Provider’ contracts there will be no guarantees of volume in the contracts awarded. Further, prices are set. 
All providers who wish to apply must do so by completing the Qualification questionnaire and Technical questionnaire which can be accessed through BravoSolution.  
Providers will need to comply with NHS West Kent CCG policies. Information about the CCG may be found on the CCG website:www.westkentccg.nhs.uk 
The Standard NHS Contract 2015/16 can be found at: 
http://www.england.nhs.uk/nhs-standard-contract/
Potential Providers are asked to please note the following: 
Providers should read the Qualification Information document and all other supporting documents, available for download on Bravo, prior to filling out the Bravo application form, paying attention to the guidance therein. 
The Bravo Messaging system for questions from Applicants will close on Friday 08 May 2015 at 12 noon, allowing time for answers to be posted and applicants to complete their applications by the reply by date of Monday 18 May 2015 at 12 noon.
If Applicants are asked Clarification Questions during the Evaluation Stages, they have 48 hours in which to respond.  Please ensure that you have staff available to answer the questions, which will be sent to you by email.  Failure to respond in the given time could adversely impact your application.
An electronic tendering tool is being used for this procurement. Interested parties should access the portal: https://www.nhssourcing.co.uk/aqp/web/login.html 
Suppliers using the portal for the first time must register to receive a password for their initial login. To Access the ITT: a) Log into the portal and click the “View Current Opportunities and Notices” link; b) Click on the Project Title: AQP IS Electives - West Kent CCG; c) Click the “Log in or Register to Participate” button on the left hand side.  Once you register your “Expression of Interest” - this will move the ITT into your “My ITTs” page (a secure area reserved for your projects only); d) Click on the ITT code (itt_2975) and the “Attachments”, “Qualification Envelope - Questionnaire”, “Technical Envelope - Questionnaire” and the “Messaging Service” can be accessed. 
Please be aware that the Bravo website, including the application sections, has an automatic timeout after 15 minutes of in activity. Activity is counted as you clicking on a hyperlink however it does not include copying and pasting text into an answer box as an action.

Organisation Name: NHS CENTRAL SOUTHERN COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT
Title: Provision of NHS 111 Services to Thames Valley
Description:
The following notice is a PIN notice only and is being placed to alert providers of an up-coming procurement exercise. Any values and timescales stated within this PIN notice are for guideline purposes only and should not be taken as a guarantee.

NHS Aylesbury Vale Clinical Commissioning Group (“CCG”) wishes to commission a Thames Valley enhanced 111 service model.

NHS 111 is a free-to-call 111 telephone number available 24 hours each day, 365 days a year, offering a personalised priority contact service that responds to individual healthcare needs when:

1.	It is not a life-threatening situation;
2.	The patient's registered General Practitioner is not an option;
3.	The caller feels they cannot wait (and may be unsure of what service they require);
4.	The caller requires health information or reassurance about what to do next.

NHS 111 forms an important part of the vision for locally integrated urgent and emergency care services. It delivers a vital service in helping members of the public with urgent care needs to gain access to the right advice in the right place, first time.
The service will be staffed by trained advisors, supported by clinicians, using a specified clinical triage tool alongside local Directory of Services to assess caller needs and determine the most appropriate course of action, which may include dispatching an ambulance, providing clinical advice or information, providing reassurance, or referring the caller to an alternative service.

At a minimum, the service provider would be expected to demonstrate a capability to deliver the National Core Specification for NHS 111 produced by the UK Department of Health, NHS 111 Commissioning Standards published by NHS England (June 2014) and the Out of Hours National Quality Requirements (“NQRs”) where this is applied for.

The service provider will need to evidence that all staff responding to callers are capable of carrying out their duties competently and to a standard that meets the requirements of the Contract Specification.

The 10 CCGs covered by this procurement exercise are:
Aylesbury Vale CCG
Bracknell & Ascot CCG
Chiltern CCG
Newbury and District CCG
North and West Reading CCG
Oxfordshire CCG
Slough CCG
South Reading CCG
Windsor Ascot & Maidenhead CCG
Wokingham CCG

The intended procurement is likely to include an element of Out of Hours health services delivery, specifically for East Berkshire, which consists of the following CCGs:
Bracknell & Ascot CCG
Windsor, Ascot & Maidenhead CCG
Slough CCG

Further details will be provided at the Supplier Briefing Event on 28.04.2015 and these will be confirmed upon commencement of the procurement process.

Please note that the services to be procured under this notice are deemed to be “Part B” Services and therefore will not be subject to the full implications of the Public Contracts Regulations 2006 (as amended) or later.
Additional Text: Suppliers who are interested in tendering for this contract will have the opportunity to attend a Supplier Briefing Event to be held on 28.04.2015 prior to the commencement of formal procurement procedures. This will provide an opportunity for suppliers to gain an insight into the required services and raise specific questions. Suppliers who wish to receive information about this event should email Mark Stanbrook on mstanbrook@nhs.net  and further details will be sent accordingly.

Organisation Name: North of England Commercial Procurement Collaborative
Title: NHS Workforce Alliance Framework Agreement for Insourced Services to Support the Provision of Healthcare Services by NHS and other public bodies (including Clinical Services)
Description: As part of the recovery from the COVID pandemic, the NHS and other public sector organisations have a requirement to supplement, support and expand their own in-house capacity through use of insourced service provision. This framework shall provide access to a wide range of insourced service solutions in support of delivery of compliant and high quality patient focused healthcare. This shall include provision of a wide range of clinical and medically related insourcing services, including but not limited to; Diagnostics, Diagnostic Imaging, Cardiology, Endoscopy, ENT, General Surgery, Gynaecology, Opthalmology, Orthopaedics, Physiotherapy, Urology, Dermatology and all other specialities and functions. A wide variety of specialisms and services in support of the provision of healthcare may be commissioned under this framework agreement, in order to provide a flexible and comprehensive solution to Participating Authorities.
